PRESIDENT
SEYMOUR N. SIEGEL
WNYC, Municipal Broadcasting System
2500 Municipal Building
New York 7, N. Y.
November 19, 1952
IfcO Frank bchooley
nSclio Station WILL
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Frank:
Thank you for your kind note of November 12
and your offer of assistance. Since you and Dunn are
responsible for this position, I guarantee you I shall
call on both of you frequently.
Already I find the mail stacking up and an
employing an additional secretary to help keep it rolling.
The Board at its Saturday night meeting in Minneapolis -
at which a quorum was present - authorized a continuation
of the $100.00 a month allowance for a secretary for the
President. I am employing Mrs. Wilma Fike on a call
basis to fill this spot. Please let me know how I should
handle her pay check with you.
Jack Morton and I will be on your campus the
evening of December 2 and morning of December 3. I
hope to be able to chat with you and others at that time.
My warmest regards always.
Sincerely yours,
Gray^aff Ausnrus, Director
Radio Broadcasting Services
Manager, WUOA(FM)
